description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4lios","text":"The FLG gene encodes the filaggrin protein which is essential for epidermal barrier formation and hydration. Mutations in the filaggrin gene are associated with a broad range of skin and allergic diseases. This protocol is used to genotype four mutations (R501X, 2282del4, R2447X and S3247X) within the FLG gene.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":4,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"8df0b","text":"Applied Biosystems QuantStudio5","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5aus1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b304c","text":"Taqman Genotyping Master Mix (Applied Biosystems Cat. no. 4371355)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"698qu","text":"MicroAmp Optical 384-Well Reaction Plate, 1,000 plates (Applied Biosystems Cat. no. 4343370)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4okv7","text":"MicroAmp Optical Adhesive Film, 100 films (Applied Biosystems Cat. no.4311971)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74g3g","text":"UltraPure Nuclease-free water, 500ml (Invitrogen Cat. no. 10977035)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9vubp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2i4lj","text":"FLG mutation-specific primers and probes:     
Sequence Detection Primer (Applied Biosystems Cat. no. 4304970)      
Taqman TAMRA Probe (Applied Biosystems Cat. no. 450025) 
Taqman MGB Probe (Applied Biosystems Cat. no. 4316034)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":42},{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"egudt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"es5tp","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d1l28","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f8ige","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"cellsMeta":{"0_0":"","0_1":"","0_2":"","1_0":"","1_1":"","1_2":"","2_0":"","2_1":"","2_2":"","3_0":"","3_1":"","3_2":"","4_0":"","4_1":"","4_2":""},"colTitles":["","",""],"colWidths":["98","398","525"],"data":[["  Mutation
  ","   Primer pairs
   
  ","   Probes
   
  "],["  R501X
  ","  Forward: 5’ CAC TGG AGG AAG ACA AGG ATC G 3’
  Reverse: 5’ CCC TCT TGG GAC GCT GAA 3’
  ","   
  Wild type 5’ 6-FAM-CAC GAG ACA GCT C-MGBNFQ 3’
  Mutant 5’ VIC-CAT GAG ACA GCT CC-MGBNFQ 3’
  FAM=C; VIC=T
   
  "],["  S3247X
   
  ","  Forward: 5’ CCA GAA ACC ATC GTG GAT CTG 3’
  Reverse: 5’ TGC CTG ATT GTC TGG AGC G 3’
  ","   
  Wildtype: 5’ 6-FAM-CAG TCA AGG CAC GG-MGBNFQ 3’
  Mutant: 5’ VIC-AGC AGT AAA GGC ACG-MGBNFQ 3’
  FAM=C; VIC=A
   
  "],["  2282del4
  ","  Forward-1: 5’ TCC CGC CAC CAG CTC C 3’
  Forward-2: 5’ CCA CTG ACA GTG AGG GAC ATT CA 3’
  Reverse: 5’ GGT GGC TCT GCT GAT GGT GA 3’
  ","   
  Wild type: 5’ 6-FAM-CAC AGT CAG TGT CAG GCC ATG GAC A-TAMRA 3’
  Mutant: 5’ VIC-AGA CAC ACA GTG TCA GGC CAT GGA CA-TAMRA 3’
  FAM=T; VIC=A
   
  "],["  R2447X
   
  ","  Forward-1: 5’ ACG TGG CCG GTC AGC A
  Forward-2: 5’ AGC ACT GGA GGA AGA CAA GGA T 3’
  Reverse: 5’ CCT GAC CCT CTT GGG ACG T 3’
  ","   
  Wild type 5’ 6-FAM-CAC GAG ACA GCT C-MGBNFQ 3’ 
  Mutant 5’ VIC-CAT GAG ACA GCT CC-MGBNFQ 3’ 
  FAM=C; VIC=T
   
  "]],"guid":"C02C513095114FEC9BB17A072DD1A329","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":79,"offset":0,"style":"bold"}],"key":"ag4j3","text":"Primers and probes for FLG mutation screening by Taqman allelic discrimination ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["  Mutation
  ","   Primer pairs
   
  ","   Probes
   
  "],["  R501X
  ","  Forward: 5’ CAC TGG AGG AAG ACA AGG ATC G 3’

  ","

  FAM=C; VIC=T
   
  "],["  S3247X

  Reverse: 5’ TGC CTG ATT GTC TGG AGC G 3’
  ","   
  Wildtype: 5’ 6-FAM-CAG TCA AGG CAC GG-MGBNFQ 3’
  Mutant: 5’ VIC-AGC AGT AAA GGC ACG-MGBNFQ 3’
  FAM=C; VIC=A
   
  "],["  2282del4
  ","  Forward-1: 5’ TCC CGC CAC CAG CTC C 3’
  Forward-2: 5’ CCA CTG ACA GTG AGG GAC ATT CA 3’
  Reverse: 5’ GGT GGC TCT GCT GAT GGT GA 3’
  ","   
  Wild type: 5’ 6-FAM-CAC AGT CAG TGT CAG GCC ATG GAC A-TAMRA 3’

  FAM=T; VIC=A
   
  "],["  R2447X

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3auhd","text":"The tables below are for one sample based on 10μL reaction volume (2μL of DNA and 8μL of reaction mix). Multiply up reaction mix by number of samples plus extra for dead-volume. Ensure a sensible amount for accurate pipetting. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cb0uc","text":"(This means that for R501X and S3247X primers will be at 300nM \u0026 probes at 100nM; and for 2282del4 and R2447X - Forward and Reverse primers will be at 500nM, Inner Forward Primer 2 at 100nM \u0026 probes at 100nM).\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"17edo","text":"Add 2μL of DNA at a concentration of 10ng/μL, for each sample to be genotyped, to a 384-well plate. Ensure at least 16 wells of the 384 have no DNA added for blank controls (these wells should still have reaction mix added).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dsls6","text":"Cycle with the following settings:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hog7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3p65m","text":" for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":5,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3qp4t","text":"  for ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":14,"length":1},{"key":5,"offset":20,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8ee4n","text":"Annealing/extension:   for {"blocks":[{"key":"e16ua","text":"Within QuantStudio Design \u0026 Analysis Software review data to ensure clear clusters are visible and that blanks are not called. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4p2q2","text":"Load 384-well plate onto heating block ensuring plate is in correct orientation with well A1 positioned top-left.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7d7na","text":"Prepare the data summary report. Include information on scanner used, SOP, analysis software version and assays used. Detail call rates and any false call rates (blanks that gave a genotype). Return summary report with raw data (eds files), exported data (excel files) and allelic cluster plots (pdf).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cd4bu","text":"Primers are sent in a concentration of 20pmol/μL and volume 500μL. To prepare primers mix 500μL of primers at 20pmol/μL with 100μL of nuclease-free water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3l7b8","text":"To prepare probes mix an equal volume of probe with nuclease-free water (based on a probe concentration of 6,000 pmol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cu0ea","text":"For 2282del4 and R2447X prepare a mastermix based on per sample volumes in the table. {"blocks":[{"key":"3mtrj","text":"Create an experiment on QuantStudio5 or load an existing experiment template (EDT file) using QuantStudio Design \u0026 Analysis Software. Ensure assay file is uploaded into library. See QuantStudio user manual for details.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fpnt4","text":"For each genotype, export data to excel and save a copy of each allelic discrimination plot as a pdf file.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hod8","text":"The FLG genotyping is looking for rare alleles so does not form the usual three clusters. The following clusters are examples to help determine final genotypes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a4mn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aqp2l","text":"
